actions-list.actionItem: The Speaker announced that the House do now adjourn pursuant to section 3(z) of H. Res. 5. The next meeting is scheduled for 9:00 a.m. on November 17, 2023.

actions-list.header: SPECIAL ORDER SPEECHES
actions-list.actionItem: The House has concluded all anticipated legislative business and has proceeded to Special Order speeches.

actions-list.header: ONE MINUTE SPEECHES
actions-list.actionItem: The House proceeded with further one minute speeches.

actions-list.header: DISTRICT WORK PERIOD
actions-list.actionItem: Pursuant to section 3(z) of H. Res. 5, the Chair announced the Speaker's designation of the period from Wednesday, November 15, 2023, through Monday, November 27, 2023, as a "district work period."

actions-list.header: POSTPONED PROCEEDINGS
actions-list.actionItem: Pursuant to clause 1(c) of rule XIX, the Chair announced further proceedings on H.R. 5894 would be postponed.
The previous question was ordered pursuant to the rule.
The House rose from the Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union to report H.R. 5894.

actions-list.header: On agreeing to the Rosendale amendment; Failed by recorded vote: 155
actions-list.actionItem: 268, 1 Present (Roll no. 675).

actions-list.header: On agreeing to the Miller-Meeks amendment; Agreed to by recorded vote: 216
On agreeing to the Miller (IL) amendment; Failed by recorded vote: 204
On agreeing to the Miller (IL) amendment; Failed by recorded vote: 155
actions-list.actionItem: 270, 1 Present (Roll no. 672).

actions-list.header: On agreeing to the Miller (IL) amendment; Failed by recorded vote: 157
actions-list.actionItem: 268, 1 Present (Roll no. 671).

actions-list.header: On agreeing to the McCormick amendment; Failed by recorded vote: 162
actions-list.actionItem: 262, 1 Present (Roll no. 670).

actions-list.header: On agreeing to the Lawler amendment; Agreed to by recorded vote: 373
actions-list.actionItem: 54 (Roll no. 669).

actions-list.header: On agreeing to the Higgins (LA) amendment; Failed by recorded vote: 144
actions-list.actionItem: 279, 1 Present (Roll no. 668).

actions-list.header: On agreeing to the Higgins (LA) amendment; Failed by recorded vote: 148
actions-list.actionItem: 280, 1 Present (Roll no. 667).

actions-list.actionItem: 14 (Roll no. 666).

actions-list.header: On agreeing to the Greene (GA) amendment; Failed by recorded vote: 165
actions-list.actionItem: 260, 1 Present (Roll no. 665).

actions-list.header: On agreeing to the Greene (GA) amendment; Failed by recorded vote: 170
actions-list.actionItem: 254, 1 Present (Roll no. 664).

actions-list.header: On agreeing to the Crane amendment; Failed by recorded vote: 151
On agreeing to the Biggs amendment; Failed by recorded vote: 173
On agreeing to the Perry amendment; Failed by recorded vote: 169

actions-list.actionItem: The House resolved into Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union for further consideration.

Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 5894 — "Making appropriations for the Departments of Labor, Health and Human Services, and Education, and related agencies for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2024, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On agreeing to the resolution Failed by recorded vote: 198
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 218

actions-list.actionItem: Considered as unfinished business. H. Res. 869 — "Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 5893) making appropriations for the Departments of Commerce and Justice, Science, and Related Agencies for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2024, and for other purposes, and providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 5961) to freeze certain Iranian funds involved in the 2023 hostage deal between the United States and Iran, and for other purposes."
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of November 15.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess for a period of less than 15 minutes.

actions-list.header: POSTPONED PROCEEDINGS
actions-list.actionItem: At the conclusion of debate on H. Res. 869, the Chair put the question on ordering the previous question and by voice vote, announced that the ayes had prevailed. Mr. McGovern demanded the yeas and nays and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.

actions-list.header: DEBATE
actions-list.actionItem: The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 869.

Considered as privileged matter. H. Res. 869 — "Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 5893) making appropriations for the Departments of Commerce and Justice, Science, and Related Agencies for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2024, and for other purposes, and providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 5961) to freeze certain Iranian funds involved in the 2023 hostage deal between the United States and Iran, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to without objection.
Considered as privileged matter. H. Res. 871 — "Electing a member to a certain standing committee of the House of Representatives."

actions-list.header: ONE MINUTE SPEECHES
actions-list.actionItem: The House proceeded with one-minute speeches, which by direction of the Chair, would be limited to five per side of the aisle.

actions-list.header: PLEDGE OF ALLEGIANCE
actions-list.actionItem: The Chair designated Mr. Bost to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Monica De La Cruz to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
